title: Prashant Kishor calls decision to not contest Bihar polls ‘mistake’
text:
Prashant Kishor accused the NDA government of promising Rs 40,000 crore of people's money, and rolling out a large chunk of it just ahead of the elections. (Express file photo)

Days after facing a crushing defeat in the Bihar Assembly Election, Jan Suraaj Party (JSP) founder Prashant Kishor on Wednesday said his decision not to contest the polls could be considered a “mistake”. He also admitted that he had not expected that his party would get less than 4 per cent votes.

Kishor’s remarks came after the JSP drew a blank in the recently held elections.
